title: Get-App, Environment documentation
description: Environment variables documentation for get-app microservice.

scopes.title: General Configuration
scopes.description: General environment variables used for all microservices

variables.name: RPC_PAYLOAD_VERSION
variables.description: Version of the payload to send, default is 1.
warning: If implemented, it must be consistent across all microservices.
variables.deprecationNote: Type 1 of RPC_PAYLOAD_VERSION is deprecated and will be removed in the future, use only type 2.

variables.name: REGION
variables.description: Defines the region used for Kafka topics and database names.
warning: If implemented, it must be consistent across all microservices.

variables.name: SERVER_NAME
variables.description: Name of the server instance.
warning: Should be unique within the deployment environment.

variables.name: DEPLOY_ENV
variables.description: Deployment environment identifier. Typical values: CTS or TNG.

variables.name: LOGGER_FORMAT
variables.description: Format of the logs output by the microservice. Can be JSON or STRING.
variables.subTitle: Logger

variables.name: LOG_LEVEL
variables.description: Defines the logging level. For JSON logger: ["fatal", "error", "warn", "info", "debug", "trace"]. For STRING logger: ["log", "error", "warn", "debug", "verbose"].
variables.subTitle: Logger

scopes.title: Microservice Client
scopes.description: Environment variables to setting the communication between the microservices.

variables.name: MICRO_SERVICE_TYPE
variables.subTitle: General config
variables.description: Type of microservice client (e.g., KAFKA or SOCKET).

variables.name: MICROSERVICE_RESPONSE_WAIT_TIME
variables.subTitle: General config
variables.description: Time in milliseconds to wait for a microservice response.

variables.name: KAFKA_BROKER_URL
variables.subTitle: Config using KAFKA type
variables.description: URL of the Kafka broker.

variables.name: KAFKAJS_NO_PARTITIONER_WARNING
variables.subTitle: Config using KAFKA type
variables.description: Disable KafkaJS partitioned warning. Set to 1 to disable the warning.

variables.name: CONSUME_CONCURRENT
variables.subTitle: Config using KAFKA type
variables.description: Number of Kafka partitions consumed concurrently.

variables.name: KAFKA_SSL
variables.subTitle: Config using KAFKA type with SSL
variables.description: Flag if connection to Kafka is by SSL.
warning: It will be implemented in the future, for now needs to define the 'DEPLOY_ENV' variable

variables.name: KAFKA_PEM_PATH
variables.subTitle: Config using KAFKA type with SSL
variables.description: File system path to the CA certificate PEM file for SSL connection to Kafka.

variables.name: KAFKA_CERT_PATH

variables.description: File system path to the client certificate PEM file for SSL connection to Kafka.

variables.name: KAFKA_KEY_PATH
variables.subTitle: Config using KAFKA type with SSL
variables.description: File system path to the client private key PEM file for SSL connection to Kafka.

scopes.title: PostgreSQL Database Configuration
scopes.description: Environment variables for configuring PostgreSQL connection and migrations

variables.name: POSTGRES_HOST
variables.subTitle: Basic config
variables.description: Hostname or IP address of the PostgreSQL server

variables.name: POSTGRES_PORT
variables.subTitle: Basic config
variables.description: Port number on which PostgreSQL is listening

variables.name: POSTGRES_DB
variables.subTitle: Basic config
variables.description: Database name to connect to

variables.name: POSTGRES_USER
variables.subTitle: Basic config
variables.description: Username for PostgreSQL authentication

variables.name: POSTGRES_PASSWORD
variables.subTitle: Auth config
variables.description: Password for PostgreSQL authentication

variables.name: POSTGRES_SSL
variables.subTitle: Auth config
variables.description: Flag if connection to PostgreSQL is by SSL.
warning: It will be implemented in the future, for now needs to define the 'DEPLOY_ENV' variable

variables.name: DB_PEM_PATH
variables.subTitle: Auth config
variables.description: File system path to the CA certificate PEM file for SSL connection to PostgreSQL.

variables.name: DB_CERT_PATH
variables.subTitle: Auth config
variables.description: File system path to the client certificate PEM file for SSL connection to PostgreSQL.

variables.name: DB_KEY_PATH
variables.subTitle: Auth config
variables.description: File system path to the private key PEM file for SSL connection to PostgreSQL.

variables.name: MIGRATION_RUN
variables.description: Flag to determine if database migrations should be run

variables.name: SERVER_PORT
variables.subTitle: General config
variables.description: The port on which the API server will run

variables.name: HTTP_PROTOCOL
variables.subTitle: TLS config
variables.description: Defines if the server run in secure mode with http protocol (true for secure), used for communication with out a wrapper like nginx, kube ingress, etc.

variables.name: CA_CERT_PATH
variables.subTitle: TLS config
variables.description: Path to the CA certificate file used to authenticate clients.

variables.name: SERVER_CERT_PATH
variables.subTitle: TLS config
variables.description: Path to the certificate file for HTTPS server.

variables.name: SERVER_KEY_PATH
variables.subTitle: TLS config
variables.description: Path to the private key file for HTTPS server.

variables.name: AUTH_SERVER_URL
variables.description: URL of the Keycloak authentication server
variables.subTitle: SSO Auth

variables.name: REALM
variables.description: Realm used in Keycloak
variables.subTitle: SSO Auth

variables.name: CLIENT_ID
variables.description: Client ID registered in Keycloak
variables.subTitle: SSO Auth

variables.name: SECRET_KEY
variables.description: Secret key for Keycloak client
variables.subTitle: SSO Auth

variables.name: COOKIE_KEY
variables.description: Key used to sign and encrypt cookies
variables.subTitle: SSO Auth

variables.name: DEVICE_AUTH
variables.description: A secret key to check against the value in the Device-Auth header
variables.subTitle: Secret Auth

variables.name: DEVICE_SECRET
variables.description: A secret key to check against the value in the Device-Auth header
variables.subTitle: Secret Auth

scopes.title: Proxy Mode
scopes.description: Environment variables that configure the application to operate in proxy mode.

variables.name: IS_PROXY
variables.subTitle: General config
variables.description: Flag to determine if the application runs as a proxy

variables.name: GETAPP_URL
variables.subTitle: General config
variables.description: Defines the URL of the main API server (not the proxy)
notes: Needs to be set only in 'delivery' microservice.

variables.name: ANALYTICS_SERVER_URL
variables.subTitle: General config
variables.description: Defines the URL of the analytics server

variables.name: GETAPP_USERNAME
variables.subTitle: API Auth
variables.description: Username used to authenticate with the main API server

variables.name: GETAPP_PASSWORD
variables.subTitle: API Auth
variables.description: Password used to authenticate with the main API server

variables.name: DEVICE_SECRET
variables.subTitle: API Auth
variables.description: A secret key that will be added to each request in the Device-Auth header
notes: It can be a string of key separated by commas, e.g., 'key1,key2,key3'.

variables.name: PROXY_SECURE_TLS
variables.subTitle: TLS Verification
variables.description: Determines whether the proxy validates the main server's TLS certificate
notes: Set to false to skip certificate validation (use with caution).

variables.name: GETAPP_URL
variables.subTitle: TLS 'with out' client certificates
variables.description: The URL of the main API server
notes: Needs to be set only in 'api' microservice.

variables.name: NODE_EXTRA_CA_CERTS
variables.subTitle: TLS 'with out' client certificates
variables.description: Path to load additional CA certificates to the service

variables.name: DIST_HTTP_PROTOCOL
variables.subTitle: TLS with client certificates
variables.description: Defines if the destination service runs in secure mode with http protocol (true for secure), used for communication the main API server with client certificates

variables.name: CA_CERT_PATH
variables.subTitle: TLS with client certificates
variables.description: Filesystem path to the CA certificate used to validate server

variables.name: CLIENT_CERT_PATH
variables.subTitle: TLS with client certificates
variables.description: Filesystem path to the client TLS certificate

variables.name: CLIENT_KEY_PATH
variables.subTitle: TLS with client certificates
variables.description: Filesystem path to the client TLS key file used in mTLS

variables.name: GETAPP_SSL_URL
variables.subTitle: TLS with client certificates
variables.description: Target hostname the main API server to establish a secure connection with client certificates
notes: The URL of the destination server should be a hostname only, without protocol. Example: 'google.com', not 'https://google.com'.
Needs to be set only in 'api' microservice.

variables.name: GETAPP_SSL_PORT
variables.subTitle: TLS with client certificates
variables.description: Port of the main API server to establish a secure connection with client certificates
notes: Needs to be set only in 'api' microservice.

scopes.title: Cache Service
scopes.description: Configuration for using the delivery service as a cache layer

variables.name: USE_CACHE
variables.subTitle: Cache Configuration
variables.description: Flag to determine whether to use the delivery service as a cache layer
notes: Requires AWS environment variables to be configured when enabled
If var IS_PROXY of proxy service is set to true, cache service will be in use even if this variable is set to false

variables.name: CACHE_CLEAR_TIME_EXPRESSION
variables.subTitle: Cache Configuration
variables.description: Specifies the cron schedule for clearing the cache

variables.name: CACHE_EXPIRATION_HOURS
variables.subTitle: Cache Configuration
variables.description: Sets the duration (in hours) for how long cached items remain valid before expiration

variables.name: CACHE_SYNC_TIME_EXPRESSION
variables.subTitle: Cache Configuration
variables.description: Specifies the cron schedule for syncing the cache data between the DB and S3

variables.name: HARBOR_CACHE_REGISTRY_URL
variables.subTitle: Harbor Registry Cache
variables.description: Harbor registry project that acts as a cache to the main Docker registry
notes: This variable is required if the cache service cached docker images.

scopes.title: S3-Compatible Storage
scopes.description: Configuration for S3-compatible object storage services, (e.g. AWS S3, MinIO).

variables.name: S3_ENDPOINT_INTERNAL
variables.description: Set the URL for S3 of container name when using a mock S3 like MinIO

variables.name: S3_ENDPOINT_EXTERNAL
variables.description: Set the external URL to get external access for downloading resources
notes: This should only be set if it is different from S3_ENDPOINT_INTERNAL.
Now enabled only using AWS S3, the S3_ENDPOINT_INTERNAL must be an external URL if external access is required.

variables.name: AWS_REGION
variables.description: AWS region for the S3 bucket

variables.name: ACCESS_KEY_ID
variables.description: Access key ID for S3 authentication

variables.name: SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
variables.description: Secret access key for S3 authentication

variables.name: BUCKET_NAME
variables.description: Name of the S3 bucket

variables.name: UPLOAD_URL_EXPIRE
variables.description: Expiration time in seconds for generated S3 upload URLs

variables.name: DOWNLOAD_URL_EXPIRE
variables.description: Expiration time in seconds for generated S3 download URLs

variables.name: MINIO_USE_SSL
variables.description: Flag to determine if MinIO server run with ssl

scopes.title: Kafka Configuration
scopes.description:
Additional environment variables for kafka service required by us.
 Exclude the general required var needed to be set for establishing a KAFKA server

variables.name: KAFKA_MESSAGE_MAX_BYTES
variables.description: The maximum size of a message that the Kafka broker will accept (in bytes).

variables.name: KAFKA_REPLICA_FETCH_MAX_BYTES
variables.description: The maximum bytes expected for each fetch response from a replica (in bytes).

variables.name: KAFKA_FETCH_MESSAGE_MAX_BYTES

scopes.title: SMTP Configuration

variables.name: SMTP_HOST
variables.description: Hostname or IP address of the SMTP server.

variables.name: SMTP_PORT
variables.description: Port number to connect to the SMTP server.

variables.name: SMTP_SECURE
variables.description: Whether the SMTP connection uses TLS/SSL.

variables.name: SMTP_USER
variables.description: Username for authenticating with the SMTP server.

variables.name: SMTP_BUG_REPORT_SUBSCRIBERS

scopes.title: Elastic APM Configuration
scopes.description: Environment variables related to Elastic APM monitoring agent.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_SERVICE_NAME
variables.description: Override service name from package.json.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_SECRET_TOKEN
variables.description: Use if APM Server requires a token.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_API_KEY
variables.description: Use if APM Server uses API keys for authentication.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_SERVER_URL
variables.description: Custom APM Server URL.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_ACTIVATE
variables.description: Set 'true' value to enable APM agent.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_DISABLE_INSTRUMENTATIONS
variables.description: Comma-separated list of modules to be excluded from instrumentation.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_ENVIRONMENT
variables.description: Override environment value.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_VERIFY_SERVER_CERT
variables.description: Set to 'false' to disable SSL certificate verification for the APM server.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_LOG_LEVEL
variables.description: Verbosity level for agent logging.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_CAPTURE_BODY
variables.description: Enable capturing the HTTP body of incoming HTTP requests.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_CAPTURE_ERROR_LOG_STACK_TRACES
variables.description: Capture APM error log stack traces.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_USE_PATH_AS_TRANSACTION_NAME
variables.description: Use the URL path as the transaction name if no route is found.

variables.name: ELASTIC_APM_ASYNC_HOOKS
variables.description: Set this option to true to enable async hooks.
